title: Strategies to Bridge Expectation Gaps for Remote Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Flexible learning schedules and practice-centered VR simulations for working professionals

learning_goals: Learners can independently perform mathematical problem-solving processes in a VR simulation environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can explain mathematical concepts at least three times through interactions with peers on an asynchronous discussion platform.

Weekly, learners submit 500-character self-assessment reports including (1) prior week's learning progress (%) and error analysis, (2) achievement level (5-point scale), (3) ≥3 specific improvement plans for the next week, achieving 'excellent' in ≥2 of 3 instructor feedback rubric items (clarity/specificity/feasibility)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
